title: An Uncharted Path to Venture Capital Founder | Kevin Moore, Serac Ventures
text:
In this episode, we sit with Kevin Moore, the fund manager at Serac Ventures. Kevin shares his unconventional journey to venture capital. Starting with a degree in civil engineering, Kevin transitioned through roles as a financial advisor, a regulatory worker at the Federal Reserve Bank, and eventually into the VC world. He emphasizes the importance of diverse experiences and a curious mindset for sourcing and evaluating investment opportunities. He discusses his methodology for investment selection and the significance of a disciplined approach across various investment mediums.

Kevin provides insights into the venture capital industry, highlighting the importance of understanding both the finance aspects and the operational challenges of startups, he also delves into the specifics of fundraising, offering advice on engaging with different types of investors, including foundations, endowments, family offices, and high net worth individuals. Furthermore, Kevin outlines the strategic focus of Serac Ventures on fintech, B2B SaaS, and commerce enablement solutions, emphasizing the fund's commitment to diversity and hands-on support for portfolio companies.
__________________________________________________

Timestamps
00:31 Kevin's Non-Traditional Path to Venture Capital
03:44 Early Investment Experiences and Strategies
05:34 First Role in Venture Capital
07:48 Insights from the Federal Reserve
09:38 Advice for Aspiring Venture Capitalists
12:18 Understanding the LP Perspective
16:48 Fundraising Tips for New Fund Managers
26:11 Defining Fund Size and Strategy
30:45 Serac Ventures: Investment Criteria and Value Add
36:30 Market Outlook and Fundraising Challenges
44:39 Closing Thoughts and Serac Ventures' Mission

Kevin's Bio:
Kevin Moore is the Founder and Managing Partner at Serac Ventures. Kevin has over 18 years' experience in public and private markets investing having worked at Spur Capital Partners (VC FoF), i2E (VC Fund), Morgan Stanley, The Federal Reserve Bank, and Northwestern Mutual. Kevin is also the author of Starting Your Investment Fund: A How to Guide and he has a Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering from Oklahoma State University and an MBA from the University of Central Oklahoma.

title: #101 Zaka Presents My Journey Kevin Moore
text:
Kevin Moore from Serac Ventures shares his journey, his vision for a more inclusive future, and the invaluable lessons he's learned along the way. He learned the value of hard work from his Jamaican family, whose unwavering commitment to success left an indelible mark on him. This early exposure to the relentless work ethic of his heritage shaped the way for his exceptional career.

As the Founder and Managing Partner, Kevin brings over 17 years of experience in finance and private markets investing to the table. His impressive track record includes a pivotal role as a Partner at Spur Capital Partners, where he deployed a staggering $129 million into top-tier, early-stage venture capital fund managers and direct investments.

Beyond his impressive career, Kevin is on a mission to address the lack of diversity in the Venture Capital world. He fearlessly confronts this issue, actively working to create positive change by championing underrepresented founders and challenging the industry's status quo.

Please follow us on social media @‌zakaconnect, check out our podcast, Zaka, on your favorite podcast provider and share http://zakaconnect.com with your networks.

#zaka #myjourney #leadershipdevelopment #growthmindset #perseverance #immigrantstories #jamaican #buildalegacy #careeradvancement #finance #privateinvestments #venturecapital

title: The Power of Personal Storytelling in Venture Capital w/ Kevin Moore of Serac Ventures
text:
In today's episode of Unlocking Venture Capital, our host sits down with Kevin Moore, GP at Serac Ventures. In this episode, Kevin will:

0:00 Trace his evolution in the venture capital industry, discussing the importance of adaptability and resilience in the face of challenges and obstacles.
2:30 Highlight the importance of Serac's diverse Guild network in providing tailored support to portfolio companies, from strategic guidance to operational expertise.
4:56 Embrace personal storytelling to build strong relationships with LPs and founders, emphasizing the crucial role of authenticity in success.
9:49 Discuss identifying and backing "iconoclastic" founders with grit and resilience, like Carmelle Cadet, founder of EMTECH, who grew up in Haiti and overcame immense challenges to build a successful fintech startup focused on enabling financial freedom for others around the world.
16:35 Examine the value of domain expertise and how Serac Ventures leverages it to provide meaningful support and guidance to their portfolio founders.
21:54 Dive into conducting thorough due diligence, avoiding red flags in the investment process, and the importance of understanding the founder's vision and motivations.
24:53 Explore Serac's focus on FinTech, SaaS, commerce enablement, and other sectors, and their approach to identifying and investing in promising startups.

This episode is a must-listen for anyone seeking to understand the inner workings of early-stage investing and gain valuable insights into the venture capital landscape. If you're a founder, be prepared to share your personal story and highlight what makes you unique. Your journey, challenges overcome, and personal motivations can be powerful factors in building strong, lasting partnerships. 

#venturecapital #venturecapitalfirm #entrepreneur  #founders   #seriesa  #PortfolioSupport #founderstories  #duediligence  #Iconoclastic #resilience  #grit  #fintech  #saas  #CommerceEnablement

Kevin that is a wrap for our episode and thank you everyone for joining us on another episode of unlocking Venture Capital I'm here with Kevin Moore and our next episode is going to come out on Monday so thank you so much my pleasure thank you

title: The Secrets to Building a Winning Investment Strategy with Kevin Moore
text:
The Secrets to Building a Winning Investment Strategy with Kevin Moore

In Episode 176, Kevin Moore, Founder and Managing Partner at Serac Ventures, shares his invaluable insights on venture capital, entrepreneurship, and problem-solving. With over 18 years of experience in public and private markets, Kevin discusses:

Why investors can't predict success and the importance of portfolio strategy.

The mindset founders need to solve big problems and build impactful businesses.

How sustainable trends like financial services innovation drive long-term investment success.

Practical advice for starting your own venture investment fund from his book Starting Your Own Venture Investment Fund: A How-to Guide.

Kevin’s unique perspective—from engineering to investing—will help you rethink how to approach challenges and opportunities in business.

👉 Subscribe for more episodes featuring top investors and entrepreneurs!
🎙️ Listen to the full episode now!

#impactinvesting #kevinmoore #podcast #venturecapital #businessgrowth #startups

title: Grow Where You're Planted: Building Serac Ventures with Kevin Moore | Alone Together | S1E1
location: Alone Together Podcast | Conversations with Solo GPs
text:
For our inaugural episode of Alone Together, I’m sitting down with my longtime friend and co-investor Kevin Moore, founder of Serac Ventures. I’ve always admired Kevin’s ability to think differently, push against the status quo, and find opportunities where others haven’t even looked yet. In this conversation, we talk about the importance of “growing where you’re planted,” going contrarian as a solo GP, and how Kevin’s bold approach has shaped both his investing strategy and our shared experiences on multiple cap tables (like SoLo Funds!).

Kevin also opens up about raising a fund from scratch—everything from corralling LPs to building a day-to-day support system when you’re going it (mostly) alone. If you want a window into the real-life ups and downs of being a solo venture capitalist, this first episode is packed with actionable tips, honest reflections, and a healthy dose of camaraderie. Enjoy!

What You’ll Learn
Growing Where You’re Planted: Why Kevin believes in focusing on local networks and opportunities right in your backyard
The Contrarian Mindset: How to spot deals others overlook—and when it pays to break from the herd
Finding Your Team as a “Solo” GP: The surprising ways Kevin has built a strong support system, from fractional CFOs to micro-community gatherings
Regulatory & LP Perspectives: Hear Kevin’s take on what LPs really look for in emerging managers, especially in today’s market
Mental Grit & Authenticity: Advice on staying grounded and true to yourself when you’re juggling the roles of founder, investor, and fundraiser all at once

About Our Guest
Kevin Moore is the founder of Serac Ventures, where he invests in early-stage companies with a “contrarian plus community” twist. His path from operator to LP to solo GP embodies the motto “grow where you’re planted.” Through Serac Ventures, Kevin supports founders by building deep, locally-rooted networks—while maintaining a big-picture vision for spotting undervalued opportunities.

Connect with me on LinkedIn or learn more about Sidecut Ventures at sidecut.vc.

Alone Together is the podcast for founders, investors, and ambitious dreamers who want a close-up look at the unconventional lives of solo GPs. Stay tuned for more real-life stories, honest advice, and a behind-the-scenes peek at our quirky corner of the venture world!

title: This is Kevin Moore - Serac Ventures
text:
On this episode I chatted with Kevin Moore, Kevin grew up in Tulsa. His childhood experiences would have pushed most off course. Kevin knew he was destined for more in life and set himself down a path for achievement. Kevin suffered bouts of homelessness, instead of becoming another statistic he applied for every scholarship, worked extremely hard and focused his entire being on becoming something everyone else thought wasn’t possible. He founded Serac Ventures an Oklahoma-based early-stage venture capital firm investing in the next generation of global companies. Our competitive advantage is our ability to invest where others won’t creating differentiated opportunities to achieve outsized returns. I hope Kevins story inspires you to change the way you look at your life. I hope you take his incremental life plan and put it in place for just one thing in your life. 

Connect with Kevin here:   / kevinjosephmoore  

Huge thank you to our sponsors.

The Oklahoma Hall of Fame at the Gaylord-Pickens Museum telling Oklahoma’s story through its people since 1927. For more information go to www.oklahomahof.com and for daily updates go to www.instagram.com/oklahomahof

The Chickasaw Nation is economically strong, culturally vibrant and full of energetic people dedicated to the preservation of family, community and heritage. www.chickasaw.net

Diffee Ford Lincoln Third generation Oklahoma business, the Diffee family continues to do business the right way, the family way. Go to www.diffeeford.net for all your new and used car needs and follow them on instagram www.instagram.com/diffee_ford

Dog House OKC - When it comes to furry four-legged care, our 24/7 supervised cage free play and overnight boarding services make The Dog House OKC in Oklahoma City the best place to be, at least, when they’re not in their own backyard. With over 6,000 square feet of combined indoor/outdoor play areas our dog daycare enriches spirit, increases social skills, builds confidence, and offers hours of exercise and stimulation for your dog http://www.thedoghouseokc.com/

title: The Path from LP to GP with Kevin Moore of Serac Ventures
text: On today's episode, we sit down with Kevin Moore to explore his journey from Limited Partner to General Partner and ultimately the inception of Serac Ventures. Kevin shares the strategic timing behind launching Serac in 2023, offering a glimpse into his unique perspective shaped by his LP experience and how it influences his role and decision-making as a GP. The episode then transitions to the topic of AI, where Kevin provides his take on the valuation frenzy and the impact of AI on VC fund ops. We also unpack Serac's investment thesis, highlighting some exciting early deals that underscore the fund's direction and the types of founders Kevin is excited about backing.

title: Early-Stage VC with Kevin Moore, Founder of Serac Ventures - Strategic Growth Podcast Ep194
channelName: The Golding Group Business Growth Consulting
text:
What better way to understand venture capital investing than by interviewing a specialist with tremendous professional experience? Our special guest is Kevin Moore, Founder and Managing Partner of Serac Ventures in Oklahoma City. Moore has over 16 years of experience in finance and private markets investing. Prior to Serac Ventures, he was a Partner at Spur Capital Partners where he led investments into top-tier, early-stage venture capital fund managers and select co-investment/direct investments. Prior to Spur, Moore was the Director of Angel Investments and Venture Advisor at i2E, a seed-stage investment firm we have discussed on this podcast previously. 

Serac Ventures is an early-stage venture capital firm that invests in the seed stage, providing the greatest opportunity for outsized returns. They back companies building technologies that expand access to capital and financial services and make work faster, more secure and more productive. Serac typically writes checks between $250K to $750K. They look for companies with a finished product, revenue, a growing customer base and a scalable and capital-efficient business model. https://www.seracventures.vc 

The Strategic Growth Podcast offers expert business insights, interviews with thought leaders and business plan triage for business owners, start-ups or anyone with a specific business problem. Listen/Stream/Subscribe to the audio podcast https://bit.ly/StrategicGrowthPodcast 
Amazon https://bit.ly/SGPonAmazon
Apple Podcast https://bit.ly/TheGoldingGroup
Audible https://adbl.co/41HkMZ1 
Goodpods https://bit.ly/SGPGoodPods 
iHeartRadio https://bit.ly/SGPiHeart
Podcast Addict https://bit.ly/SGPodAddict
Podchaser https://bit.ly/SGPodchaser
Pod Link https://pod.link/1275659816
Spotify https://bit.ly/SGPSpotify
Spreaker https://www.spreaker.com/user/thegold...

Subscribe, so you never miss an episode. Tell a friend, leave a review and engage with us on social media.
Twitter   / goldinggroup   @GoldingGroup
Facebook   / strategicbusinessgrowth  
LinkedIn   / the-golding-group  
Instagram   / thegoldinggroup   @TheGoldingGroup

To contact us for advice, assistance or collaboration: https://thegoldinggroup.com/contact-us/

title: Finding Opportunities on the Edges:  Kevin Moore's Investment Strategy #shorts
text:
Discover the secret of successful investing with Kevin Moore, GP of Serac Ventures! 🚀 Kevin reveals that the key to making money as an investor lies in identifying opportunities on the edges - where founders have an asymmetric advantage. By targeting unique characteristics in founders, Serac Ventures has tapped into a market gap that others have overlooked. Kevin's journey from working in a homogenous environment to starting his own venture fund showcases the power of thinking differently in the VC world. 💡💰

Ready to revolutionize your approach to investing? Check out our full episode on our YouTube. 🎧🎥👀

#investment #investor #entrepreneur #founders #venturecapital #vc #interview #podcast
